wikipedia_page.main: Michael Lutener Laws (born 12 August 1926) is a former English cricketer who played eight games of first-class cricket, mostly  for Middlesex, between 1946 and 1950. He was born in Finchley and attended Highgate School. An amateur cricketer, he played as a wicketkeeper.

response: Michael Laws (born 1957) is a New Zealand politician, broadcaster and writer. Laws was a Member of Parliament for six years, starting in 1990, initially for the National Party. In Parliament he voted against his party on multiple occasions and in 1996 defected to the newly founded New Zealand First party, but resigned Parliament the same year following a scandal in which he selected a company part-owned by his wife for a government contract.

Michael Laws has five children. The eldest two are from relationships prior to his political career; the youngest three, with former partner Leonie Brookhammer, were born during Laws' Whanganui mayoralty. Laws and Brookhammer separated in 2009.
